skill.description: UX research and design toolkit for Senior UX Designer/Researcher including data-driven persona generation, journey mapping, usability testing frameworks, and research synthesis. Use for user research, persona creation, journey mapping, and design validation.

skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 57 static findings are false positives. The analyzer misidentified Python's random module for persona name selection as cryptographic code. No actual cryptographic algorithms, network exfiltration, or malicious patterns exist. This is a benign UX research tool that generates personas from user data.

content.user_title: Generate User Personas from Research Data
content.value_statement: Transform raw user interview data into actionable personas. Create data-backed user profiles with goals, frustrations, behaviors, and design implications in minutes instead of hours.
actual_capabilities: Generate personas from user interview data and survey responses
Identify persona archetypes including power user, casual user, business user, and mobile-first
Extract psychographics like motivations, values, and attitudes
Create usage scenarios and user journey touchpoints
Derive actionable design implications from persona patterns
Export personas as structured JSON for design tools
limitations: Requires user research data as input (does not conduct interviews)
Does not create visual designs or UI mockups
Does not perform statistical significance testing on research data
Uses sample names for persona output which should be replaced with real names

use_cases.title: Synthesize Interview Data
use_cases.description: Convert raw interview transcripts into structured personas that communicate user insights to stakeholders.

use_cases.title: Inform Design Decisions
use_cases.description: Generate personas to guide feature prioritization and validate design choices against user needs.

use_cases.title: Communicate User Segments
use_cases.description: Create shareable persona documents that help teams align on target users and their priorities.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Persona
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a user persona for a frequent mobile user who values efficiency and speed

prompt_templates.title: Interview-Based
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a persona based on these interview findings: 20 users, 60% daily usage, primary pain point is slow loading times

prompt_templates.title: Segment Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate two contrasting personas: one for power users who use 15+ features daily, and one for casual users who log in monthly

prompt_templates.title: Journey Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a business user persona with scenarios for team collaboration, including pain points around poor permission management

output_examples.input: Generate a persona for a mobile-first user who shops online during commute
output: A daily user who primarily uses the product for personal purposes
Goals: Access anywhere, quick actions, offline capability
Frustrations: Poor mobile experience, desktop-only features, slow loading
Design Implications: Mobile-first responsive design, touch-optimized interactions

output_examples.input: Create personas from user research data showing work context dominates
output: A regular user who primarily uses the product for work purposes
Goals: Improve team efficiency, track metrics, integrate with tools
Frustrations: Lack of reporting, poor collaboration features, no enterprise features
Design Implications: Professional visual design, enterprise features like SSO and audit logs

best_practices: Input at least 20 users for medium confidence persona, 50+ for high confidence
Include interview quotes to make personas feel authentic and quotable
Review and replace generated names with actual user-derived names for authenticity
anti_patterns: Using personas without validating against real user research data
Creating personas from assumptions rather than gathered insights
Ignoring data confidence levels when presenting personas to stakeholders

faq.question: What data format does persona_generator.py accept?
faq.answer: It accepts user data as a list of dictionaries with fields like age, usage_frequency, features_used, and primary_device.

faq.question: Can I export personas to Figma or other tools?
faq.answer: Yes, use the JSON output flag to get structured data that can be imported into design tools.

faq.question: How many personas should I create?
faq.answer: Three to five personas typically cover most user segments without overwhelming teams.

faq.question: Does this tool analyze interview transcripts?
faq.answer: It processes structured interview insights, not raw transcript text. Pre-process transcripts first.

faq.question: What confidence levels indicate data quality?
faq.answer: Low for under 20 users, Medium for 20-50, High for over 50 users in the sample.

faq.question: Can I customize the archetype templates?
faq.answer: Yes, modify the archetype_templates dictionary in the Python file to add custom user types.
